title: Find LCD
text: The least common denominator of $$\frac{2p+4}{8}$$ and $$\frac{p+18}{6}$$ is $$24$$.
speech: The least common denominator of  fraction, 2 p plus 4, over 8,   and , fraction, p plus 18, over 6,   is  24 .
pacedSpeech: The least common denominator of   fraction, 2 p plus 4, over 8,

title: Multiply LCD Both Sides
text: Through multiplying both sides by LCD, we get $$3\left(2p+4\right)=4\left(p+18\right)$$.
speech: Through multiplying both sides by LCD, we get  3 times, parentheses, 2 p plus 4,  is equal to 4 times, parentheses p plus 18,  .
pacedSpeech: Through multiplying both sides by LCD, we get   3 times, , 2 p plus 4,  is equal to 4 times,  p plus 18,

title: Isolate $$p$$ on One side
text: We can further simplify $$3\left(2p+4\right)=4\left(p+18\right)$$ to $$6p+12=4p+72$$. By subtracting $$12$$, we get $$6p=4p+60$$. We can subtract $$4p$$ both sides and get $$2p=60$$. Lastly, we can divide both sides by $$2$$ and get $$p=30$$ as the final answer.
speech: We can further simplify  3 times, parentheses, 2 p plus 4,  is equal to 4 times, parentheses p plus 18,   to  6 p plus 12 is equal to 4 p plus, 72 . By subtracting  12 , we get  6 p is equal to 4 p plus, 60 . We can subtract  4 p  both sides and get  2 p is equal to, 60 .
